parameters:
\N<Ryuda Soldier>I'll need you to open up, I'm a messenger from the
management office.

\N<Ryuda Soldier>It's an urgent summons from Lord Zuuteruka. Report to the
management office immediately.
\N<Irime>Hey, can you open up for me?
\N<Irime>Sorry to intrude, is it a bother?

\N<Segi>No, I was just about to take a rest, but it's fine. More
importantly, what brings you here, Irime-san?

\N<Irime>Oh, sorry about that. It's not like I have any particular
business, but I just can't seem to relax. You know... with
the match tomorrow and all.
\N<Segi>Oh, is that so... It's natural to feel anxious.

\N<Irime>Well, it'd be a lie to say I'm not worried at all. But I'm
trying to be as prepared as I can be.

\N<Irime>It's just... the Lyuda soldiers were saying some strange
things. That's been bothering me a bit. I thought maybe you
might know something about it.

\N<Irime>You know... the first fight is just a warm-up. It's kind of
like an assessment. The second fight... that is, tomorrow is
when the real battle begins for me.
\N<Segi>The real battle starts from the second fight...?

\N<Segi>Now that you mention it, Zuuteruka said something like that
before... but I don't understand what it means...

\N<Irime>Ah, looks like you haven't heard anything. That's fine then,
sorry for the intrusion.
\N<Segi>I apologize... for not being of any help.

\N<Irime>It's okay, don't worry about it. Didn't I say I'm prepared
for whatever happens? See you tomorrow.

\N<Segi>...Today is the day of Irime-san's match. What did she mean
by the real battle starting from the second fight...

\N<Segi>But for now... there's no use worrying about it. I need to
focus on what's in front of me...

To raise funds, Segi can sell her personal belongings. These
items are not sold at regular stores but can be done at the
Ryuda barracks.

Also, please note that once sold, no new personal items will
be added until the next battle.
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this, but...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>...I really don't want to do this...
\N<Segi>The day of my battle has finally come...

\N<Segi>It's the day that will decide the fate of myself, Riia, and
Lord Yuia.
\N<Segi>I must go to the training grounds...

\N<Segi>That's right... The item I asked Mr. Hojiko for... I never
did receive it.

\N<Segi>But... now's not the time to worry about that. I have to go
to the training grounds...
\N<Segi>I must go to the training grounds...
\N<Segi>Oh, not again... My body... it's so hot...

\N<Segi>And... this sensation is getting more intense than the last
time I felt it...
\N<Segi>...It's nothing. I just wanted to see Riia's face for a bit.

\N<Segi>Hehe... It's fine, isn't it? Just let me look at you for a
little while.
\N<Segi>(I need to hurry... to the management office.)

\N<Segi>Hey, Riia. How's your training at the academy going? What
happened with that person you told me about last time?

\N<Riia>Look, Mom. I've become a bit stronger recently, you know?
Maybe it's all thanks to the training?

\N<Riia>With this, maybe I could fight in the war games instead of
Dad...?

\N<Riia>Look, Mama. I've become a bit stronger recently, don't you
think? Is this all thanks to my training?

\N<Riia>With this, maybe I could fight in the war instead of
Papa...?

\N<Riia>It seems like Rame-chan has been lacking energy lately... I
wish there was something I could do...

\N<Riia>I want to see Papa... Hey, Mama, when do you think Papa will
come home? Tomorrow? The day after tomorrow?
\N<Segi>...I'm home, Riia. Sorry for being late...

\N<Riia>Yeah... welcome back... Mom. Was the teacher here until just
now...?

\N<Segi>I'm sorry... for worrying you. You came to pick me up,
didn't you? I heard about it from the people of Ryuda... Did
they do anything to you?

\N<Riia>Yeah... I'm fine, the teacher was with me. Are you okay,
Mom...?

\N<Segi>Yeah... Mom's okay. I was actually a little tired, but
seeing Riia's face made all the fatigue blow away. So from
tomorrow... I can keep going strong.

\N<Segi>Right, Riia... Let's keep our heads up and move forward. No
matter how tough the path is, Mom will be with you, okay...?

As I looked back at my son with a worried gaze, those vague
words were all I could muster.

Maybe I was really saying them to myself. Maybe they were
the words I wanted to hear.

On the other side of a single mirror, I had been violated by
men other than his father. Such things are unspeakable.

Yet... looking at my beloved son's face, I manage to regain
my composure.
This must surely... have been necessary.

To reclaim a bright future for our family... I deliberately
covered myself in mud.

With such baseless... convenient reasoning, I restore my
shadowed heart.

\N<Segi>Hey, Riia... let's keep our heads up and move forward, no
matter how tough the road ahead is. Mama will be with you,
okay...?

\N<Segi>Hehe, don't make such a face. I'm just stepping out for a
bit. No need to worry, I'll be back soon.
\N<Segi>So... can you wait here for me, can you do that?
\N<Segi>Sorry for being late. You were worried, weren't you?

\N<Riia>Yeah... but it's okay... because we made a promise, right?
That I would become strong. That I wouldn't cry easily.

\N<Segi>That's right... Yes, Riia, you're amazing. Maybe even more
so than Mama.

\N<Riia>Why? Mama is strong too. The master also said so, right?
That Mama is strong.
\N<Riia>That's why, you know, both Papa and Mama are my pride.
Mama... I can't bear to look at your face just for tonight.

Because Mama... was with a boy who isn't much older than
you...

Sorry... I'm so sorry, Riia. I know that no matter how much
I apologize, I can't erase the facts...

\N<Riia>I want to see Papa... Hey, Mama, when do you think Papa will
come back? Maybe tomorrow? Or the day after tomorrow?

\N<Segi>...Today is the day I promised to meet with Zuuteruka. I
must go to the management office...

\N<Segi>There's no need to think about it. If it's for saving Lord
Yuia, I will...

\N<Segi>...Today is the day I promised to meet with Zuuteruka. I
must go to the management office...

\N<Segi>There's no need to think... If it's for saving Lord Yuia, I
will...
- About the purpose of the Military Training Assembly
- About the Military Training Assembly regulations

The religious society that conquered and destroyed "Dawn's
Ear," the hometown of Segi and Yuia, manages its followers
through unique scriptures and military force.

It can be called a night-watch state, and in recent years,
it has expanded its influence by subjugating surrounding
villages one after another with its advanced technology and
military power.

Each family is forced to provide one representative for
military service, and these representatives are made to
fight each other in combat tournaments for training
purposes.

Multiple duels among residents are held simultaneously, and
afterwards, a few outstanding soldiers are selected to be
recruited into the Lyuda ranks.

After the opponent is decided, the duel takes place after a
few days of grace period. During this time, the
participating warriors will devise strategies for the fight.

The duel is decided by death, incapacitation, or surrender.
However, even surrender does not guarantee safety
thereafter.

If defeated in battle, men are imprisoned and subjected to
harsh forced labor. Women are forced to live as the
concubines of the victors or Lyuda soldiers.

Segi's ultimate goal is to win the training tournament and
use the amnesty as a prize to rescue her imprisoned husband,
Yuia.

To do this, she must gather information about her opponents
in the tournament, train herself in the ruins, and win the
competition.

As Yuia is imprisoned as a serious criminal, it is essential
to continue paying tributes to Lyuda for his life extension
measures, and Segi must not fail to do so during the
tournament.

If the tributes cease, it means that the guarantee for her
imprisoned husband Yuia's life is lost.

The side effects caused by Segi, who lacks combat
experience, taking the secret drug "Mind.Lyuda" to enhance
her physical abilities.

Her lust rises and accumulates daily, and when it reaches
its limit (maximum value 100), an uncontrollable intense
sexual urge will overcome her body.

To prevent lust, it is necessary to lower the maximum value
through meetings with her husband Yuia or medication.
Engaging in sexual acts is also effective in relieving
sexual urges.

The ruins that gave their name to the underwater ruins city
where Segi and others live. It was once a mine dug using
criminals.

Rare resources were excavated inside the ruins, but at the
same time, it became a dangerous place filled with poisonous
gases and rampant monsters.

The poisonous gases continue to seep out even now. However,
since Lyuda's technology has developed an antidote to avoid
the gases, exploration inside has become possible.

The story is divided into chapters for each match, such as
the first match  second match.

Gather information for your next battle in town, explore the
ruins to acquire money and items.

In scenes where useful information or story-progressing
events occur, a [EV occurrence] mark will be displayed.

\C[1]Blue indicates \C[0]conversation events or story progression
flags, \C[10]red\C[0] indicates when an event scene is
included.

The story may progress by advancing the date. If you feel
that nothing is progressing, rest in your home bed.

If there is a \C[3]Rest Possible\C[0] mark on your home
bed, you can recover your strength and move forward to the
next day.

In this case, minor conversation events that could occur on
that day will not happen as time moves on to the next day.

Also, each character generally appears in the same place. It
is recommended to visit places like Rozaro's tavern or
Irime's home regularly as they are allies.

Segi's ultimate goal is to win the training tournament
without defeat. If achieved, she can save her husband Yuia
and their family can return to their former life.

However, if Segi is defeated by men who aim to fight her in
the tournament, she will become theirs.

By being defiled by them, Segi will face an ending with each
of those men.

On the eve of the final match of the training tournament,
she must choose an ending with one of the men, whether she
wishes to or not...
\N<Riia>Mom... you're late. I wonder where you really went...

\N<Rozaro>...She might be at the management office. Should we head
there just in case?
\N<Riia>Y-yes. Will you come with me, sensei?

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. There was a
faint shadow cast upon her expression.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. A clear
gloominess could be seen on her face.
\N<Segi>...I don't want to think about anything right now.

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her face
was flushed, and her breaths contained a sweet tinge.

\N<Segi>...haah...haah...why is this happening...what's going to
happen to my body...?

Segi stared at her own reflection in the mirror. Her
expression was no different from usual.
\N<Segi>...There's no particular problem. I can still go on...
